Description: Body sherd of North Ionian black-figured pottery closed vessel (oinochoe or amphora); interior reserved with wheelmarks; exterior, cream slip: part of a lion to left, raising its right foreleg towards another animal (winged?); added red on neck and in eye of lion and wing(?) of other animal ; field ornaments: rosettes and dotted rosettes; dilute line and perhaps band of tongues above figured zone. Clay of sandy feel, with some lime inclusions and a fair amount of small silver mica.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.663)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
